alert.note: Alert for Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Lexington and Richland. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 639 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres, Springdale, St. Andrews, Dentsville, Oak Grove, Red Bank, South Congaree, Pine Ridge, Arcadia Lakes, Riverbanks Zoo, West Columbia Riverwalk, Five Points, Columbia International University, SC State Fair Grounds and Harbison State Forest. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 26 between mile markers 104 and 117. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 56 and 80. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 3...and near mile marker 5...and between mile markers 9 and 24. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Minor flooding will occur in the Five Points area extending downstream along Rocky Branch Creek. This includes Maxcy Gregg Park, areas of the USC campus along the creek, the intersection at Pickens and Blossom, the intersection at Whaley and Main and areas of the Olympia neighborhood along the creek.
